alert.note: Alert for Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 11:11PM CDT until August 30 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Tom Green. This includes the city of San Angelo. * WHEN...Until 115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Street flooding and minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1108 PM CDT, radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with heavy rain across Tom Green County and San Angelo. Rainfall could exceed an inch across at least some of the area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Angelo, Lake Nasworthy, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Wall, O.c. Fisher Reservoir and San Angelo State Park. - This includes the following DSS Events... Test event at NWS-SJT. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Howard and Webster, College Hills and Millbrook, Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, 300 block of North Archer, 1500 Block of Spaulding, Parkwood and Lindenwood, Sul Ross At Red Arroyo Crossing, Huntington and Sunset and Huntington and Sunset. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
